API Documentation¶

class flirimageextractor.FlirImageExtractor(exiftool_path='exiftool', is_debug=False, palettes=None)¶

Instance of FlirImageExtractor

check_for_thermal_image(flir_img_filename)¶

Given a valid image path, return a boolean of whether the image contains thermal data.

Parameters:

flir_img_filename – File path or file like object to load the image from

Returns:

Bool

extract_embedded_image()¶

extracts the visual image as 2D numpy array of RGB values

Returns:

Numpy Array of RGB values

static extract_float(dirty_str)¶

Extract the float value of a string, helpful for parsing the exiftool data.

Parameters:

dirty_str – The string to parse the float from

Returns:

The float parsed from the string

extract_thermal_image()¶

extracts the thermal image as 2D numpy array with temperatures in oC

Returns:

Numpy Array of thermal values

get_image_type()¶

Get the embedded thermal image type, generally can be TIFF or PNG

Returns:

Given a valid file path or file-like object get relevant metadata out of the image using exiftool.

Parameters:

flir_img_file – File path or file like object to load the image from

Returns:

get_rgb_np()¶

Return the last extracted rgb image

Returns:

get_thermal_np()¶

Return the last extracted thermal image

Returns:

Loads an image file from a file path or a file-like object

Parameters:

file – File path or file like object to load the image from

Returns:

plot(palette=<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>)¶

Plot the rgb and thermal image (easy to see the pixel values), include a matplotlib colormap to change the colors

Parameters:

palette – A matplotlib colormap to display the thermal image in

Returns:

process_image(flir_img_file, RGB=False)¶

Given a valid image path, process the file: extract real thermal values and an RGB image if specified

Parameters:

  • flir_img_file – File path or file like object to load the image from

  • RGB – Boolean for whether to extract the embedded RGB image

Returns:

static raw2temp(raw, E=1, OD=1, RTemp=20, ATemp=20, IRWTemp=20, IRT=1, RH=50, PR1=21106.77, PB=1501, PF=1, PO=-7340, PR2=0.012545258)¶

convert raw values from the flir sensor to temperatures in C # this calculation has been ported to python from # https://github.com/gtatters/Thermimage/blob/master/R/raw2temp.R # a detailed explanation of what is going on here can be found there

save_images(minTemp=None, maxTemp=None, bytesIO=False)¶

Save the extracted images

Parameters:

  • minTemp – (Optional) Manually set the minimum temperature for the colormap to use

  • maxTemp – (Optional) Manually set the maximum temperature for the colormap to use

  • bytesIO – (Optional) Return an array of BytesIO objects containing the images rather than saving to disk

Returns:

Either a list of filenames where the images were save, or an array containing BytesIO objects of the output images

class flirimageextractor.ThermalImage(image_path, camera_manufacturer, color_map='jet', thermal_np=None)¶

Thermal Image class.

extract_temperatures_dji()¶

Extracts the DJI-encoded thermal image as 2D floating-point numpy array with temperatures in degC.

The raw sensor values are obtained using the sample binaries provided in the official Thermal SDK by DJI. The executable file is run and generates a 16 bit unsigned RAW image with Little Endian byte order. Link to DJI Forum post: https://forum.dji.com/forum.php?mod=redirect&goto=findpost&ptid=230321&pid=2389016

extract_temperatures_flir()¶

Extracts the FLIR-encoded thermal image as 2D floating-point numpy array with temperatures in degC.

generate_colorbar(min_temp=None, max_temp=None, cmap=2, height=None)¶

Function to generate a colourbar image that can be stitched to the side of your thermal image.

Parameters:

  • min_temp (int, optional) – Minimum temperature on colourbar. If not passed, then the image’s minimumtemperature is taken. Defaults to None.

  • max_temp (int, optional) – Maximum temperature on colourbar. If not passed, then the image’s maximumtemperature is taken. Defaults to None.

  • cmap (cv Colormap, optional) – Which false colour mapping to use for the colourbar. Defaults to cv.COLORMAP_JET.

  • height (int, optional) – Height of the colourbar canvas to be used. If not passed, takes the height of the thermal image. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A colourbar of the required height with temperature values labelled

Return type:

np.ndarray

save_thermal_image(output_path)¶

Converts the floating-point temperature array into an image and saves the image.

Takes the current self.thermal_np temperature array, converts it to image-friendly uint8 format. Then it computes and stitches a colourbar for required scale. Finally it saves the image to the specified output path

Parameters:

output_path (str / Path) – Save destination for the thermal image
